issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: AWS requires that if you specify path when creating user the path ends with "/" euca does not have this requirement. Furthermore, if you follow AWS rule and create a user in Eucalyptus and add the trailing slash to the path the result is a double slash in the path. Seen anywhere IAM path option can be used. Euca Output: {code} [10:09:21] [b-13 | 10.111.1.13]: euare-usercreate -u test-user -p /users -v EUARE_URL environment variable is deprecated; use AWS_IAM_URL instead arn:aws:iam::495375389014:user/users/test-user AIDXKRYHPZ2MPU7CBQ8YT [10:16:32] [b-13 | 10.111.1.13]: euare-usercreate -u test-user2 -p /users/ -v EUARE_URL environment variable is deprecated; use AWS_IAM_URL instead arn:aws:iam::495375389014:user/users//test-user2 AIDW07YX1BMOMV3AAKAZR [10:16:42] [b-13 | 10.111.1.13]: euare-userlistbypath EUARE_URL environment variable is deprecated; use AWS_IAM_URL instead arn:aws:iam::495375389014:user/admin arn:aws:iam::495375389014:user/users/test-user arn:aws:iam::495375389014:user/users//test-user2 {code} AWS output {code} [10:09:53] [b-13 | fields.summary: Create user path differences between Euca and AWS

comments.body:
[~tony],

Looks like in AWS it is possible to create users with path names with a forward slash (/users) and also a forward and a trailing slash (/users/) . Also, looks like the AWS doc enforces the the forward slash only [1]. So, you think the output in the example AWS output could be another TOOLS issue?

Tested by creating the following users with AWS IAM tool,
{noformat}
$ iam-usercreate -u test-user -p /users --debug
$ iam-usercreate -u test-user1 -p /users/ --debug
{noformat}

[1] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/LimitationsOnEntities.html
I've created users with _/users_ and _/users/_ paths. Both works and resulted in _/users/_.
